results.title: The Greatest designers: Paris: Karl Lagerfeld
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Reeder, Marlene McGinnis Cardin and Videofashion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Designers”.
The Greatest Designers: Paris focusses on the work and influence of a selection of French fashion designers, including Chanel, Paul Poiret, Jacques Firth, Elsa Schiaparelli, Cristobal Balenciaga, Hubert de Givenchy, Emanuel Ungaro, Andre Courreges, Pierre Cardin, and Thierry Mugler. Karl Lagerfeld, considered one of the most prolific designers of the twentieth century, is renouned for both his highly-priced ready-to-wear fashion and his philosophical quotes on the business of fashion designing. His designs, capable of turning any woman into a star, are mostly light and fluid in their construction. He worked in couture as an assistant for several years before becoming a freelance designer, which ultimately led him to developing his own signature line, as well as designing for Fendi, Chloe, and Chanel. In the 1980’s, Lagerfeld was responsible for rejuvenating the Chanel label by adapting the Chanel suit and re-working it in weird and wonderful ways.

results.title: Who killed the sale?
results.creator_credit: Michael Tuchner, Anthony Pelissier, Ian Latimer and Rank Organisation Short Films Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Customer and You”.
An amusing film in Cleese style of a case study which shows that employees in all parts of a company can affect a company’s ability to get and to keep business. With Bud Tingwell.

results.title: New voices
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”.
In a world where the fortunes of one people crisscross with others, it is to be expected that the voices of Muslim countries will be raised on world issues. At the United Nations and other international gatherings, this film watches and listens to the new leaders of the Islamic world. What you see and hear has much meaning for you, and even more significance for the new African nations among whom Islam is a live and growing force.

results.title: The Contest for power
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”.
Change is neither easy nor even. In this film you see neighboring countries in North Africa and the Middle East with vastly different forms of government. In monarchies, all power resides in a king; in others, military juntas rule. Here and there democratic governments hold power. Everywhere, from Iraq to Algeria, the ferment of change shows in many ways. Part four of the original six-part series.

results.title: The Impact of the west
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”.
The counter-wave of western expansion breaches the closed frontier of Islam - Napoleon in 1798, quickly followed by the British. From the Muslim defeat rose the new nationalism, an upsurge intensified by two world wars and the emergence of the new state of Israel. Part two of the revised seven-part series.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Algeria
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”.
Indicative of the direction and strength of Muslim revolt against European colonisers was the struggle for Algerian independence. This film recapitulates Algeria’s history up to the signing of the French-Algerian agreement and the last-ditch stand of the secret, outlaw European army. Figures of the Algerian resistance emerge on the screen as the film follows the Algerian resistance army to their mountain stronghold and takes a look at the peace conferences in France. Narrated by James Beveridge. Edited by Dennis Sawyer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
